alert.note: Alert for Kidder; Stutsman (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 21 at 6:25PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Kidder and Stutsman counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until Noon CST Thursday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 3 PM Wednesday to Noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel due to blowing snow reducing visibility. A blizzard will develop Wednesday afternoon, and will continue through Thursday morning, creating dangerous to impossible travel conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. Notify a friend or family member of your travel plans. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing.
